name.description: The name of the postgresql Admin service instance

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each postgresql node.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to each postgresql node.

postgres_host.description: The name of the postgresql instance to connect to.

postgres_host_port.description: The port where the postgresql server is listening on. Defaults to 5432

virtual_host.description: Virtual Host URL to be used in the external load balancer. Modify as per your installation.

port_external.description: Port number to be used for clear communication in the external load balancer

persistence.description: Enable or disable data persistence. If enabled, requires configuration of a valid host_volume.

host_volume.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting data. The final location will be derived from this value plus the name set in `name` (e.g. `/mnt/host_volume/postgresql-admin`). This can be a mounted NFS drive. Note that this path must be the same on all DCOS agents.

volume_size.description: If a new volume is to be created, this controls its size in MBs. Defaults to 64MBs

documentroot.description: Path to the web document root inside the container

logdir.description: Path to the log directory inside the container

rundir.description: Path to the run directory inside the container

lockdir.description: Path to the lock directory inside the container

webserver.description: postgresql admin web server configuration properties

name.description: The name of the web server process that displays the UI.

server_admin.description: Username of the server admin. Defaults to admin@localhost

run_user.description: User that the web server runs under

run_group.description: Group that the web server runs under
